alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence; Marion; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 7:25PM EDT until August 07 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... South central Darlington County in northeastern South Carolina... Northwestern Marion County in northeastern South Carolina... Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 725 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Woods Bay State Park, or 13 miles northeast of Manning, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Florence, Lake City, Kingstree, Andrews, Timmonsville, Johnsonville, Pamplico, Quinby, Hemingway, Blue Brick, Mars Bluff, Cades, Poston, Cartersville, Nesmith, Indiantown, Gresham, Earle, Hebron, and Morrisville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
